page.title: 03Nature in N.St Ives.
page.content: In and around St.Ives there are a lot of fields but most of it is farmers' land.There are some foot paths around Houghton.There are not that many hedges because farmers have chopped them down for more space for their crops.The people who live here do not think this is a good idea as much wildlife is destroyed.Also people are concerned about the spraying of chemicals on crops.It is quiet most of the time,although the aircraft from RAF Wyton can cause quite a disturbance. There are a few woods about like Crows Wood or the Spinny but you couldn't get lost in them because they are too small. Small animals found in the area include rabbits,hares,hedgehogs,rats, squirrels.
